text: it's vacation season which means a lot
of us like me are going to shop for a
new camera and it's getting hard to
decide yes most of us take most of our
photos with our phone but there's still
a reason to have a separate camera that
choice used to come down to a
point-and-shoot compact that sort of
duplicates what the phone does or a big
heavy expensive hard to use DSLR but now
there's a middle ground this is one of a
new category of cameras called
mirrorless cameras or sometimes called
compact interchangeable lens cameras
because some of them can swap out the
lenses I have recently fallen in love
with this one right here the Fujifilm xt
one because it has this cool retro
design manual dials right here basically
they're smaller and lighter than DSLRs
but they have the same size sensor and a
bigger sensor means better pictures
they are though easier to use they have
more controls for manual operation than
a point-and-shoot camera but not quite
as many menu options as a DSLR and they
take great photos in auto mode but it's
basically the top of the line for a
mirrorless camera look for one that cost
about six hundred to a thousand dollars
and you'll be happy I think there are
still good reasons to own a compact
point-and-shoot camera namely that
they're better for kids than your
fragile phone or mirrorless camera and
also more and more of them are getting
really rugged this is the fujifilm
finepix XP 200 and I like it because you
can drop it and you can even take it
swimming or snorkeling it also has Wi-Fi
so your pictures are not stuck on your
camera forever you can actually upload
them straight from your hotel room and
this guy only cost around $300 I am a
little bit of a tech nerd so I like to
have one of each but I have to say I'm
very intrigued by this idea of a
high-end and yet more compact and easy
to use digital camera the mirrorless
cameras offer so much more flexibility
that I actually think you would end up
using it a little more than a DSLR I
might be sold
Oh
